base64.title: base64 encoded value
base64.description: a standard base64 encoded value, as defined in RFC 4648

meta.title: metadata
meta.description: metadata about this test vector, such as its id, version, data about its generation, etc.

id.title: a unique identifier that identifies this test vector

version.title: the version of this test vector

description.title: an optional description of the test vector

comment.title: optional comments about this test vector, e.g. applicability, hints, rationale, etc.

gen.title: generation metadata
gen.description: metadata about how this test vector was generated

preconditions.title: execution preconditions
preconditions.description: preconditions that need to be applied and satisfied before this test vector can be executed

state_tree.title: state tree to seed
state_tree.description: state tree to seed before applying this test vector; mapping of actor addresses => serialized state

postconditions.title: execution preconditions
postconditions.description: postconditions that need to be satisfied after execution for this test vector to pass

state_tree.title: state tree postconditions
state_tree.description: state tree postconditions that must be true for this test vector to pass

receipts.title: receipts to match
receipts.description: receipts to match, required when using messages-class test vectors; length of this array MUST be equal to length of apply_messages

apply_messages.title: messages to apply, along with the receipt to expect for each

class.title: test vector class
class.description: test vector class; depending on the value, the apply_* property to provide (and its schema) will vary; the relevant apply property is apply_[class]

selector.title: selector the driver can use to determine if this test vector applies

car.title: car containing state trees
car.description: the gzipped, base64 CAR containing the pre- and post-condition state trees for this test vector
